title: Engagement
text: Develop and maintain a community of practice among key stakeholders including public health decision-makers and practitioners, academic researchers, and surveillance system leads.

title: Team
text: ACEFA involves multiple academic research groups from across Australia including the Infectious Disease Dynamics Unit at the University of Melbourne, Infectious Disease Ecology and Modelling group at Telethon Kids Institute, Defence Science and Technology Group, and colleagues at Monash University, University of New South Wales, Australian National University, James Cook University, and the University of Adelaide. The consortium’s work builds on a national seasonal influenza forecasting program (2014–19) and COVID-19 situational assessment consortium (2020–23).

Australian Consortium for Epidemic Forecasting & Analytics








Working to support the timely, effective response to epidemic diseases in Australia through real-time data analytics, modelling, and forecasting.




























Decision Support


Generate and share real-time analyses with Australian decision-makers and the public.













Methods and Tools


Advance methods and software tools for epidemic analysis.













Data


Inform the design of surveillance studies to optimise data collection for public health action.













Engagement


Develop and maintain a community of practice among key stakeholders.
